phrases.definition: Getting sincere about something; applying oneself seriously to a job
Someone or something that one finds to be agreeable or delightful
Usually this references a tool used by rescuers when they pry or cut open a car to save the occupant
Being in a dangerous or very deadly situation
To cut the mustard is to meet a required standard, or to meet expectations
One who escalates small things and turns them into big problems
Having confidence in a specific outcome; being almost sure about something
To be watchful; paying careful attention to something
Being fit as a fiddle means to be in perfect health
Someone that calls for help when it is not needed. Someone who is lying
Starting over again on a new design from a previously failed attempt
The state of being happy; feeling delighted
Getting away freely from custody, punishment, or any type of risky situation
